column1: Skrolli;At the Skrolli booth you can try out older and more unique home computers that you may recognize from the pages of the magazines. You can also let us know if you'd be interested in an international edition of Skrolli and of course subscribe Skrolli for 2026 or purchase older issues. column1: KymiSec Ry;"KymiSec ry is part of the CitySec family. We are an information security community based in the Kymenlaakso region of Finland. Our goal is to organize infosec-related meetups and events focused on learning and networking.
KymiSec works in cooperation with Cyber Club Kotka (CCK). Anyone interested in information security and cybersecurity is welcome to join us
column2: meet like-minded people

column1: https://kymisec.fi"
Cyber Club Kotka;Cyber Club Kotka
column2: officially known as Kotkan Kyberturvallisuusinsinööriopiskelijat ry
column3: is the student association for cybersecurity students at XAMK. Our goal is to help students find friends and get to know each other at the very beginning of their studies
column4: support networking within the cybersecurity field
column5: and offer members shared activities and events related to cybersecurity as well as activities beyond the field.

column1: KuoSec ry;KuoSec ry is part of CitySec family. It is an infosec community located at Kuopio
column2: Finland. Our purpose is to organize meetups and get-togethers focused on training and networking. Anyone interested in the Infosec field is welcome to join us
column3: meet likeminded people and hopefully learn something new. https://kuosec.fi

column1: Halko - Hacklab Kuopio ry;Halko - Hacklab Kuopio ry is a non-profit communal workspace / makerspace in Kuopio
column2: Finland. We provide spaces
column3: equipment and community for many kinds of projects involving both tech and art. Everyone 18+ is welcome to come visit us on our twice per week open days and check out the premises and meet people. Experience is not required
column4: Halko is a great space to get inspiration
column6: work on projects and have fun. https://halko.fi

column1: PoroSec;"The InfoSec Community of Northern Finland

The Information Security community from the northern part of Finland (mainly Rovaniemi) welcomes anyone interested in information security or eager to learn something new. We organize meetups and events for infosec enthusiasts."
H-T8 Hacking Club;"H‑T8 is a student‑driven hacking club created by students
column2: for students. Our mission is to open the doors to the exciting world of cybersecurity and help newcomers take their first steps as ethical hackers.

column1: We organize excursions
column2: CTF competitions and student events where members can learn practical skills and network. Whether you’re an absolute beginner or already exploring advanced topics
column3: H‑T8 offers a supportive community where curiosity and experimentation are encouraged.

column1: For many
column2: we are the first real connection to cybersecurity
column3: and we take pride in making that introduction fun
column5: and inspiring. We offer content for all skill levels
column6: from basic introductions to advanced activities. Our experienced members also form a competitive CTF team that participates in contests throughout the year.

column1: If you’re a student or someone who enjoys supporting students in this field
column2: come join us and be part of the H‑T8 community! https//ht8.fi/"

LahtiSec;Lahti Cyber Security Society (LahtiSec) is the CitySec chapter in Lahti, Finland. We host meetups three times a year, grow the local security community, and make cyber security easier to approach whether you’re a pro, a student, or just curious. Visit our Community Village stand to meet the crew, hear what's going on (including KyberLahti 2026), and catch a little “Business City” energy!
Women4cyber Finland ;Women4Cyber Finland is a non profit association dedicated to advancing women’s careers in cybersecurity
column2: thus increasing diversity and equalizing the existing gender imbalance. As Finland’s official chapter within a European network of over 30 chapters
column5: and strengthen the national cyber talent pool.

column1: We contribute to public dialogue
column2: host networking and learning events
column3: and provide support and up to date insights in close cooperation with our partners."

column1: SaimaaSec;Information security community from Lappeenranta. We organise meetups and community events on a regular basis. We welcome anyone interested in information security
column2: whether you are a student

column1: Lockpicking Village;Four experienced/professional lockpickers teaching and showing how locks and lockpicking works. We aim to introduce the basics of physical security to everyone
column2: so that together the security concious minds would improve total security.

column1: Testausserveri;Testausserveri is an open community for young and young minded people interested in programming
